ttl.name: VEHICLE STABILITY CONTROL SYSTEM(w/ Pre-collision System)

para.dtcname: Yaw Rate Sensor Signal Bias Level Out of Range / Zero Adjustment Failure
Yaw Rate Sensor Component Internal Failure

content5.ptxt: The skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly) receives signals from the yaw rate and acceleration sensor (airbag ECU assembly) via the CAN communication system.
The airbag ECU assembly has a built-in yaw rate and acceleration sensor and detects the vehicle condition.
If there is trouble in the bus lines between the acceleration sensor (airbag ECU assembly) and the CAN communication system, DTCs U012587 are set.
These DTCs are also output when calibration has not been completed.

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Yaw Rate Sensor Signal Bias Level Out of Range / Zero Adjustment Failure

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: With the vehicle stationary, the yaw rate sensor output value is not 0Â°/s.

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Yaw Rate Sensor Component Internal Failure

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: When the +BS terminal voltage is from 9.5 to 17.4 V, a data malfunction signal is received from the yaw rate sensor.

atten3.ptxt: If the yaw rate and acceleration sensor (airbag ECU assembly) was replaced or reinstalled, perform "Calibration".

atten4.ptxt: When U012587 and/or U012687 is output together with C006328 and/or C006396, inspect and repair the trouble areas indicated by U012587 and/or U012687 first.
If troubleshooting has been carried out according to the Problem Symptoms Table, refer back to the table and proceed to the next step.
